chapter.para: The Rackspace &CImS; enables developers to create and manipulate images, image members, and associated metadata through a simple Representational State Transfer (REST) web service interface.
The Rackspace Cloud Images Developer Guide provides detailed information about how to use the &CImA; v2.
This chapter describes what images are, how you share images with others, and how you use asynchronous image tasks.

section.title: Images
section.para: Server images are used to store a snapshot of a server's configuration. If you take an image of a server, you can create a new server from that image. The new server will have the same files and operating system that the original server had at the time the image was created.
The &CImS; provides operations that enable you to manipulate images, to import and export images (by using tasks), and to share images with other people.

To learn how to use an existing image, see "POST_importImage_tasks_Image_Task_Calls"
Section 4.4.3. "Task to Import Image" in the Cloud Images Developer Guide.

The &CImS; enables you to use standard images (which are supported by Rackspace) and to create, share, and use nonstandard images (which are not supported by Rackspace). For more information, see
Rackspace Standard and Non-Standard Images at http://www.rackspace.com/knowledge_center/article/rackspace-standard-and-non-standard-images.

section.title: Statuses
section.para: The &CImA; uses a variety of statuses to identify the state of images or image components. This section describes the statuses and their values.

section.title: Image statuses
section.para: Images in the &CImS; can have any of the following statuses when you display details by using the instructions in "GET_getImage_images__image_id__Image_Calls" “Get details for an image”.

listitem.para: The image identifier has been reserved for an image in the Cloud Images registry. No image data has been uploaded to the &CImS;, and the image size was not explicitly set to zero on creation.
An image's raw data is being uploaded to the &CImS;.
The image is fully available in the &CImS;. This status applies either after the image is uploaded or if the image size is explicitly set to zero on creation.
An error occurred during the image upload process, and the image data is unreadable.
The &CImS; has retained the information about the image, but the image is no longer available to use. An image with this status will be removed automatically at a later date.
This status is similar to deleted, however, the &CImS; has not yet removed the image data. An image with this status is recoverable.

section.title: Task statuses
section.para: Image tasks in the &CImS; can have any of the following statuses when you poll them by using instructions in "GET_getTask_tasks__taskID__Image_Task_Calls" “Get details for a task”.

listitem.para: The image task is waiting for execution.
The image task did not complete successfully.

section.title: Image member statuses
section.para: Image members can have any of the following statuses when you view image member details by using the instructions in "GET_getImageMember_images__image_id__members__member_id__Image_Both_Calls" “Get image member details”.

listitem.para: The member has accepted the invitation to potentially use the offered image.
The member has declined the invitation to potentially use the offered image.
The member has neither accepted nor declined the invitation to potentially use the offered image.
